tidymodels using bayes optimization

Machine learning
tidymodels

XGBOOST using bayes optimization

dondon true
2021-07-05

머신러닝 모델의 성능을 결정하는데 가장 중요한 요인 중 하나는 hpyerparameter를 어떻게 튜닝할지 결정하는 것이다. tidymodels 패키지에서는 hyperparameter 튜닝에 관한 다양한 튜닝 방법을 제공한다. tidymodels에서 제공하는 대표적인 튜닝 방법은 다음과 같다.

  • grid regular

  • grid_random

  • grid_max_entropy

  • grid_latin_hypercube

  • bayes tune

이 중 bayes tune은 가장 오래걸리지만 성능이 가장 좋은 방법이다. 백문이 불여일견이기 때문에 튜토리얼 코드를 올린다. 데이터는 kaggle 튜토리얼에서 많이 활용하는 bike sharing demand 데이터를 가져왔다. 실제로 xgboost를 bayes tuning 한 후에 제출하면 top 3% 정도 랭크된다.

데이터 출처

https://www.kaggle.com/c/bike-sharing-demand

Preparations

Libraries

library(tidymodels)
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)
library(skimr)
library(magrittr)
library(data.table)
library(gridExtra)
library(themis)

theme_set(theme_bw())

Data load

file_path <- getwd()
files <- list.files(file_path)
files

[4] "tidymodels-using-bayes-optimization_files"
[5] "train.csv"                                
train <- read_csv(file.path(file_path, "train.csv"))
test <- read_csv(file.path(file_path, "test.csv"))

data preprocessing

combine train, test

all_data <- bind_rows(train, test)

Change variable type

all_data$season <- factor(all_data$season, labels = c('winter', 'fall', 'summer', 'spring'))
all_data$weather <- as.factor(all_data$weather)
all_data$workingday <- as.factor(all_data$workingday)
all_data$holiday <- as.factor(all_data$holiday)

create date variable

all_data %>% mutate(year = year(datetime), 
                    month = month(datetime),
                    wday = wday(datetime),
                    day = day(datetime), 
                    hour = hour(datetime)) %>% 
    select(year, month, wday, day, holiday, workingday, everything()) -> all_data

convert wday, month

all_data$wday <- factor(all_data$wday, labels = c('Sun', 'Mon', 'Tue', 'Wed', 'Thur', 'Fri', 'Sat'))
all_data$month <- as.factor(all_data$month)

univariate visualization

count(target variable)

all_data %>% 
    ggplot(aes(x = count)) + 
    geom_histogram()

count 변수를 보면 0인 count가 많음

atemp, temp

p1 <- all_data %>% 
    ggplot(aes(x = atemp)) + 
    geom_histogram()
p2 <- all_data %>% 
    ggplot(aes(x = temp)) + 
    geom_histogram()

grid.arrange(grobs = list(p1, p2), col = 2)

temp, atemp 분포는 거의 비슷함

casual, registered

all_data %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = registered)) + 
  geom_histogram()

all_data %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = casual)) + 
  geom_histogram()

var(all_data$registered, na.rm = T)

[1] 22812.79
mean(all_data$registered, na.rm = T)

[1] 155.5522
var(all_data$casual, na.rm = T)

[1] 2496.049
mean(all_data$casual, na.rm = T)

[1] 36.02195

train data에는 존재하지만 test 데이터에는 존재하지 않는 count variable이다. 두 변수의 분포를 보면 0의 비율이 매우 많고, 과대산포되어있는 것을 볼 수 있다.

Visualization of correlations and distributions (holiday)

all_data %>% 
    select(holiday, temp, humidity, windspeed, count) %>% 
    GGally::ggpairs(mapping = aes(color = holiday))

Visualization of correlations and distributions (workingday)

all_data %>% 
    select(workingday, temp, humidity, windspeed, count) %>% 
    GGally::ggpairs(mapping = aes(color = workingday))

factor variable visualization

season vs count

all_data %>% 
    group_by(season, hour) %>% 
    summarise(count = sum(count, na.rm = T)) %>% 
    ggplot(aes(x = hour, y = count, color = season)) +
    geom_line(size = 1.5, alpha = 0.7)

weather vs count

all_data %>% 
    group_by(weather, hour) %>% 
    summarise(count = sum(count, na.rm = T)) %>% 
    ggplot(aes(x = hour, y = count, color = weather)) +
    geom_line(size = 1.5, alpha = 0.7)

wday vs count

all_data %>% 
    group_by(wday, hour) %>% 
    summarise(count = sum(count, na.rm = T)) %>% 
    ggplot(aes(x = hour, y = count, color = wday)) +
    geom_line(size = 1.5, alpha = 0.7)

holiday vs count

all_data %>% 
    group_by(holiday, hour) %>% 
    summarise(count = sum(count, na.rm = T)) %>% 
    ggplot(aes(x = hour, y = count, color = holiday)) +
    geom_line(size = 1.5, alpha = 0.7)

workingday vs count

all_data %>% 
    group_by(workingday, hour) %>% 
    summarise(count = sum(count, na.rm = T)) %>% 
    ggplot(aes(x = hour, y = count, color = workingday)) +
    geom_line(size = 1.5, alpha = 0.7)

all_data %>% 
    group_by(month, hour) %>% 
    summarise(count = sum(count, na.rm = T)) %>% 
    ggplot(aes(x = hour, y = count, color = month)) +
    geom_line(size = 1.5, alpha = 0.7)

temp vs atemp

a1 <- all_data %>% 
  mutate(hour = as.factor(hour)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=hour, y = registered)) + geom_boxplot()

a2 <- all_data %>% 
  mutate(hour = as.factor(hour)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=hour, y = casual)) + geom_boxplot()

grid.arrange(a1, a2)

Discretize

humidity의 경우 0 값이 22개 존재함. humidiy 값이 0인 경우를 결측치 대체함. windspeed가 0인 경우도 마찬가지로 결측치로 보고 대체함 weather의 경우 4 level의 빈도가 매우 작기 때문에 3 level과 통합

all_data %>% 
    recipe(count~.) %>% 
    step_other(weather, threshold = 0.1, other = 3) %>% 
    step_discretize(windspeed, min_unique = 5, num_breaks = 5) %>%
    #step_discretize_xgb(windspeed)
    prep(training = all_data) %>% 
    bake(new_data = all_data) -> all_data

Recipe + preperation

bike_res <- all_data %>% 
  recipe(count~.) %>% 
  step_rm(datetime, registered, casual) %>%
  step_mutate(year = as.factor(year)) %>% 
  step_log(count, offset = 1) %>%
  step_dummy(all_nominal()) %>%
  step_nzv(all_numeric()) %>% 
  prep(training = all_data)

Juice

all_data2 <- juice(bike_res)

Split train, test

train_index <- seq_len(nrow(train))
train2 <- all_data2[train_index,]
test2 <- all_data2[-train_index,]

XGboost setting

XGBOOST hyperparameter setting

xgb_spec <- boost_tree(
    trees = 1000, # 앙상블에 포함되는 tree의 수 NA= tune(), # 얼마만큼 노드를 split할건지 NA= tune(), # 노드를 분할하는데 필요한 최소 데이터의 수NA= tune(), # 노드 분할에 필요한 loss의 감소량 NA= tune(), # The amount of data exposed to the fitting routine
    mtry = tune(), # The number of predictors that will be randomly sampled at each split when creating the tree models. 
    learn_rate = tune() 
) %>% 
    set_engine('xgboost', objective = "reg:squarederror") %>% 
    set_mode('regression')

params <- parameters(xgb_spec) %>% 
    finalize(train2)

XGboost workflow

workflow model setting

xgb_wf <- workflow() %>% 
    add_formula(count~.) %>% 
    add_model(xgb_spec)

cross validation

set.seed(2021)
vb_folds <- vfold_cv(train2, v = 5, strata = count)
vb_folds

#  5-fold cross-validation using stratification 
# A tibble: 5 x 2
  splits              id   
  <list>              <chr>
1 <split [8707/2179]> Fold1
2 <split [8707/2179]> Fold2
3 <split [8710/2176]> Fold3
4 <split [8710/2176]> Fold4
5 <split [8710/2176]> Fold5

bayes tuning

library(tictoc)
tic()
doParallel::registerDoParallel()
xgb_res <- tune_bayes(
    object = xgb_wf, # recipe, formula를 지정해준 workflow NA= vb_folds, 
    param_info = params, 
    iter = 30, 
    metrics = metric_set(rmse), 
    initial = 10, 
    control = control_bayes(
        verbose = TRUE, 
        no_improve = 10, 
        seed = 123) 
)
toc()  

1717.58 sec elapsed

Final model update

best_param <- select_best(xgb_res, 'rmse')
final_xgb <- finalize_workflow(xgb_wf, best_param)
final_xgb

== Workflow ==========================================================
Preprocessor: Formula
Model: boost_tree()

-- Preprocessor ------------------------------------------------------
count ~ .

-- Model -------------------------------------------------------------
Boosted Tree Model Specification (regression)

Main Arguments:
  mtry = 20
  trees = 1000
  min_n = 9
  tree_depth = 11
  learn_rate = 0.0258353587692691
  loss_reduction = 8.14951174339789e-06
  sample_size = 0.719988768889047

Engine-Specific Arguments:
  objective = reg:squarederror

Computational engine: xgboost

final model setting

final_model <- finalize_model(xgb_spec, best_param) 
final_model # tuning이 끝난 최종 모형 NA
Boosted Tree Model Specification (regression)

Main Arguments:
  mtry = 20
  trees = 1000
  min_n = 9
  tree_depth = 11
  learn_rate = 0.0258353587692691
  loss_reduction = 8.14951174339789e-06
  sample_size = 0.719988768889047

Engine-Specific Arguments:
  objective = reg:squarederror

Computational engine: xgboost

final model workflow에 업데이트

final_workflow <- xgb_wf %>% update_model(final_model)

final model 학습

xgb_fit <- fit(final_workflow, data = train2)

Result

Prediction

pred_xgb <- 
    predict(xgb_fit, test2) %>% 
    mutate(modelo = "XGBoost")
pred_xgb %>% head()

# A tibble: 6 x 2
  .pred modelo 
  <dbl> <chr>  
1  2.67 XGBoost
2  1.62 XGBoost
3  1.52 XGBoost
4  1.19 XGBoost
5  1.03 XGBoost
6  1.88 XGBoost
pred_xgb$.pred <- exp(pred_xgb$.pred)-1

feature importance plot

library(vip) # feature importance plot 그리기 NAfinal_xgb %>% 
    fit(data = train2) %>%  # iter, training_rmse 
    pull_workflow_fit() %>% #  http://www.rebeccabarter.com/blog/2020-03-25_machine_learning/
    vip(geom = 'point')
